basics.name: Steve Meza
basics.label: web developer, data geek, sports enthusiast
basics.summary: Master’s candidate in Data Analytics successful in tackling complex new projects with initiative and focus. Skilled problem-solver able to communicate with users at all levels of technical proficiency to troubleshoot, resolve and document requests for help with desktop, laptop, mobile, network and other peripheral problems. Particularly adept in breaking down technical information into easy to understand communications, helping in various training scenarios.

work.summary: Administer data entry tasks of fleet department. Close work orders opened for work completed by mechanic shop. Code and process invoices correctly for parts ordered by Fleet Manager, Shop Supervisor, Parts Manager, and shop mechanics. Collaborate with Accounts Payable department for any invoicing issues.
highlights: Assist Fleet Manager and Shop Supervisor in tracking unit inspections per D.O.T. compliance regulations
Created and maintain Preventative Maintenance schedule for fleet of approximately 1400 units.
Provide support to Fleet Manager and Shop Supervisor for various reporting tasks on weekly basis, including revenue data.

Puerto Rico Restoration Effort, Jan 2018 - April 2018: Tracked and logged worked hours for 60 employees on 7-day work schedule (timesheets were submitted daily). Managed up-to-date status log for 55 company-owned units, including material handlers and pickup trucks. Served as liaison for correspondences between contractor (Con Edison) and ground crew.

work.summary: Greet clients at consultation desk of department. Qualify client’s repair needs. Offer appropriate repair services. Troubleshoot client’s tech and solve any minor issues. Log all client concerns and issues regarding malfunctioning tech. Create service orders accordingly.
highlights: Engage customers to assess extent of damage to customer devices while suggesting suitable repair services.
Foster client-like relationships with customers by providing customized solutions to repair needs.
Market appropriate services to clients as part of complete repair solution while correctly qualifying client's needs.
Educate clients on repair services performed, including original issues addressed and issues found during repair process.
Publicize and promote service plan offered by Best Buy to help save clients money on repair services when applicable.
Monitored business operations to achieve weekly goals of high customer satisfaction through careful coordination of project tasks.
Tracked schedule of 82 employees accurately for weekly payroll.
Logged quality assurance reports to improve and maintain quality of service.
Optimized delivery schedule of necessary supplies through keen observation of inventory upkeep on routine basis.
Reviewed engineering drawings submitted by architect/engineer, creating itemized list of lighting fixtures to be allocated for planned construction.
Compiled cut sheets of fixtures, highlighting relevant information essential to project design and implementation.
Produced submittal packages to be utilized by estimating manager for quotation and bid proposal purposes.
Received calls in promptly and professionally to assist Adecco associates and colleagues with any payroll inquiries.
Accurately logged all calls, highlighting major issues and following up on pressing matters if necessary.
Provided training and additional support to newly hired call center agents.

work.position: Mobile Device Repair Technician / Sales Associate
highlights: Repaired damaged mobile devices, including iPhones, iPads, iPad Minis, and Samsung Galaxy devices.
Handled glass digitizers, LCDs, logic boards, cameras, batteries, and flex cables with great care to minimize costs of damaged parts.
Organized daily business operations with emphasis customer service and satisfaction.
Improved efficiency of task coordination in effort to help streamline management of contracts.
Tracked critical dates (received, acknowledged, responded) and action items for each transmittal, including Requests For Information (RFIs) and submittals from project contractor.
Managed logs of cost estimates for several areas of project, including potential modifications to contract, specifications, and engineering schematics.
Conducted on-site inspections and field tests of completed construction work, producing daily reports for CM team records.
